Issue.title: Issue
Issue.description: Represents an IT issue reported by a user.

userId.description: Reference to the User who reported the issue. (Relationship: User 1:N Issue)

issueType.description: The general category of the issue.

customIssueType.description: A user-defined issue type, if 'Other' is selected.

status.description: Current status of the issue (e.g., Open, In Progress, Resolved).

createdAt.description: Timestamp indicating when the issue was reported.

updatedAt.description: Timestamp indicating when the issue was last updated.

completedAt.description: Timestamp indicating when the issue was resolved.

resolvedBy.description: The UID of the admin or IT support user who resolved the ticket.

resolvedByDisplayName.description: The display name of the user who resolved the ticket.

unreadByAdmin.description: True if there are unread messages for an admin or IT support.

unreadByUser.description: True if there are unread messages for the ticket owner.

User.title: User
User.description: Represents a user of the IssueTrackr application.

role.description: Role of the user (e.g., User, Admin).

ChatMessage.title: Chat Message
ChatMessage.description: Represents a single message within a ticket's chat session.

userId.description: The ID of the user who sent the message.

displayName.description: The display name of the user who sent the message.

text.description: The text content of the message. Optional.

audioUrl.description: URL to the audio file in Firebase Storage. Optional.

link.description: A URL for a call or other resource. Optional.

type.description: The type of message (e.g., standard user message or a system notification).

createdAt.description: Timestamp indicating when the message was sent.

isRead.description: True if the message has been read by the recipient.

/users/{userId}.description: Stores user profiles. Listing of users is disabled to prevent unauthorized access. The 'userId' parameter represents the unique identifier for a user.

/users/{userId}/issues/{issueId}.description: Stores issues reported by a specific user. The 'userId' parameter represents the owner of the issue, ensuring path-based ownership. The `issueId` parameter represents the unique identifier for an issue within a user's issues.

/users/{userId}/issues/{issueId}/message.description: Stores chat messages for a specific issue. Both the user and support staff can post messages here.
